cont.entity_a: Many additional features with DD-WRT software.
Router crashes occasionally and requires multiple reboots.

cont.entity_b: No 802.11n specs but good speeds with MIMO.

cont.entity_a: Solid hardware for tweaking with alternative software.
cont.entity_b: Overheats if stacked under other devices.

cont.entity_a: Good range and performance when operational. Less range than a Netgear Wireless-G router.
cont.entity_b: Extremely stable with fantastic range. Reliable with good broadcast range.

Setup.comm: Easy to use management web interface.

cont.entity_a: Easy installation with provided materials. Setup wizard on CD doesn't work with Windows XP.
cont.entity_b: Easy setup with reliable performance. Easy WPA setup. Customer service is helpful for setup.

cont.entity_a: Somewhat buggy firmware requiring reboots for wireless functionality. Firmware issues with NAT, wireless connection, USB storage, and DHCP. Discontinued product with no firmware support from Linksys. Standard firmware requires daily reboots. Lost connectivity issues; Linksys working on firmware update.
cont.entity_b: Requires firmware update for best performance.

cont.entity_a: More configurable than some other home routers.
cont.entity_b: Fast download and upload speeds. Fast and reliable for PC and MAC.
Supports strong WiFi encryption. Easy to use interface with excellent security features.
Works great with X-Box Live and Nintendo Wi-Fi. Good for Xbox 360 with proper port forwarding. Best gaming router for Xbox Live. GameFuel feature supports VoIP.

cont.entity_a: Requires daily reboot to maintain functionality.
cont.entity_b: Handles multiple devices without dropping signal. Handles many connections without slowing down.

cont.entity_a: Sticker overlay suggests a different hardware revision.
